page.title: 04STREET NAMES
page.content: Many street names in the area give clues to the history of Braintree. An estate of semi_detached houses is named for the orchard which once occupied the ground. Names include Peartree Walk, Appletree Walk, Orchard Drive, Worcestor Close and Russett Close. Aetheric Road is named after an Anglo Saxon leader who fought against invading Vikings at Maldon and who died of his wounds. The Courtauld family were instumental in Braintree's former prosperity and have roads named after them. John Ray Street commemorates the life of one of Britain's earliest naturalists who was born at Black Notley.
